[SYNTAX]: Severe sentence fragmentation and illogical word order (e.g., "I definite was a the college...").
[GRAMMAR]: Repeated misuse of prepositions and articles (e.g., "unprepared ready, diploma go to out for but position").
[LEXICON]: Awkward phrasing ("explained unfinished might next gymnasium...").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between anecdotes (e.g., unsignaled switch from first to second young man).
[STRUCTURE]: Tangential details (e.g., agricultural school appointment) disrupt narrative flow.

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "The time is rapidly drawing to a close...");
[LEXICON]: Redundant phrasing (e.g., repeated emphasis on application details without clear transitions);
[STRUCTURE]: Minor disjointedness in paragraph flow (e.g., abrupt shift to anecdotes).

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between ideas (e.g., dress sense to educational preparation);
[STRUCTURE]: Anecdotes feel disconnected from preceding paragraphs;
[CLARITY]: Repetitive themes (e.g., references/applications) without clear progression.
